story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race OMG (Oxford MS Gravel)? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) scored 39 out of 100. Grassroots tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race OMG (Oxford MS Gravel)?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: OMG (Oxford MS Gravel). Oxford, MS. 50 mi. Mississippi hills gravel.
beats.text_on_screen: OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) | Oxford, MS | 50 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. Here's where it lands. Value. 3 out of 5. The math works out. Barely. Entry fee isn't listed but Mississippi races typically run reasonable. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Plan for a few hundred all-in. Logistics. 2 out of 5. You'll figure it out. Eventually. Part of the Mississippi Gravel Cup series organized by Matt Roland, Jason Shearer, and Landon Voller with confirmed 2025 date of January 11. Length. 2 out of 5. Won't destroy your week. Ben Gabardi won the 50-mile distance in 2:33:59. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Some chunky bits. Nothing catastrophic. Holly Springs National Forest terrain features 'rolling hills, fun descents, gorgeous forest views and well-packed gravel service roads. Elevation. 2 out of 5. Some ups and downs. Manageable. The 100-mile route gains over 7,000 feet through sustained rolling hills rather than major climbs. Climate. 2 out of 5. Weather cooperates more often than not. January weather proved memorable in 2021 when Bart Luther noted 'Having snowflakes in Mississippi was a bonus! Adventure. 2 out of 5. Some interesting terrain. Mostly familiar. The 2021 race drew 'riders from all around Mississippi and even people from eight other states as far as Iowa and Colorado.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Nothing special about the race execution. Experience. 2 out of 5. Pleasant enough. Won't change your life. Community. 2 out of 5. Polite. Not exactly warm. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Nobody at the coffee shop will recognize this name. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Small field. You might podium by showing up.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: Where OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) earns its score.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Lodging: Oxford has lodging. Book ahead.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Mississippi Gravel. If you're local to MS/Southeast. yes, it's solid. If you're traveling. skip it.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If OMG (Oxford MS Gravel) isn't quite right for you. For better Southeast races: Check regional options.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced OMG (Oxford MS Gravel)? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, 'OMG (Oxford MS Gravel)' bold text, tier badge 'GRASSROOTS', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
